item.title: New note
item.author: hello@roytang.net (Roy Tang)
item.description:
Has this “government” actually made any comment on the price difference as compared to other vaccines?

Quoted cnnphilippines's tweet:
Roque on govt’s suppposed preference for Sinovac: Yun ang vaccine na una nating nakuha, at ang Western brands, na lantad ang colonial mentality sa mga Pilipino, July pa natin makukuha earliest

item.title: New note
item.author: hello@roytang.net (Roy Tang)
item.description:
Over 40. I think yes, even in the 90s. I do remember hearing about things like Saddam invading Kuwait, fall of the Soviet Union, Desert Storm, etc. The main difference for me today is that we get a lot more “internal to the US” news, or maybe that’s just the sources I follow.

Quoted itxaropena's tweet:

Over 30s of Twitter,

Was your teenage life surrounded with many world events?

Was the world this crazy back then?

item.title: New photos
item.author: hello@roytang.net (Roy Tang)
item.description:
I just noticed that @duolingo web has great keyboard support, even in this “click to select words” mode. You can type to select words from the list, and enter/backspace work as you expect

(embarrassingly, the answer I have in the above screenshot is already wrong lol)

Unsurprisingly, the keyboard support doesn’t work for Japanese mode

item.author: hello@roytang.net (Roy Tang)
item.description:
I have yet to see any Valki Vartokamus jokes and I am disappointed in all of you #mtg #MTGKaldheim

Quoted SaffronOlive's tweet:
Geez, god/planeswalker MDFC. At first glance it seems really solid. Valki is good early, Tibalt gives you late game utility.

item.title: New note
item.author: hello@roytang.net (Roy Tang)
item.description:
If this isn’t some allegory for what we face as a country, IDK what is

Quoted PhilippineStar's tweet:
The Philippine Eagle Foundation (PEF) on Friday announced the passing of Philippine Eagle Pag-asa, the icon of conservation efforts in the country.

item.title: Reply to switchfollows's tweet at https://twitter.com/switchfollows/statuses/1347277522531086337/:
item.author: hello@roytang.net (Roy Tang)
item.description:
Reply to switchfollows's tweet at https://twitter.com/switchfollows/statuses/1347277522531086337/:

@switchfollows I’ve been meaning to do something like that, but I mine aren’t something I’ve really concretely/formally defined ever (though I guess the blog does some of that work for me). I feel like a lot of my thought processes are straightforward and obvious, but maybe that’s just my POV

item.title: New note

item.description: The last time the US considered the 25th amendment was back in 1997 when president James Marshall was held hostage by terrorist and Radek loyalist Egor Korshunov aboard Air Force One

item.title: New note
item.author: hello@roytang.net (Roy Tang)
item.description: I was watching the CNN live feed for around 2hrs in the early morning over here as the insurrection was breaking. It invoked memories of watching the twin towers collapse on the news from half a world away, less than 20 years ago

item.title: Repost from FloydWhaley https://twitter.com/FloydWhaley/statuses/1323570439432544259/:
item.author: hello@roytang.net (Roy Tang)
item.description:
Repost from FloydWhaley https://twitter.com/FloydWhaley/statuses/1323570439432544259/:

There was no New Year’s Eve in the Philippines in 1844. The Philippines redrew the International Date Line to simplify trade with its Asian neighbors. As a result, local time in the Philippines jumped from December 30, 1844 to January 1, 1845. https://www.atlasobscura.com/articles/in-1844-the-philippines-skipped-a-day-and-it-took-decades-for-the-rest-of-the-world-to-notice

item.title: New note
item.author: hello@roytang.net (Roy Tang)
item.description:
PSA: if you keep your timeline in “latest tweets” mode (click sparkly blue icon on top right of app) you will have a chronological timeline and never have to see what your follows like. I always forget that’s a thing since I never see it

Quoted daretorant's tweet:

I feel like folks don’t fully realize that liking a tweet puts it into their followers’ feeds (almost at the same rate that RTs do).

When I see a tweet because “X liked this”, I am now re-evaluating whether I should follow them because of their “like curations”

item.title: New photos
item.author: hello@roytang.net (Roy Tang)
item.description: Last-minute mythic on #magicarena to close out the year. #mtg Eternal is close to Master Rank too, but I don’t think I have the energy for it. Honestly, grinding to Mythic takes too much time, so maybe I won’t push it so hard in 2021. Or maybe just in December lol

item.title: New note
item.author: hello@roytang.net (Roy Tang)
item.description: Finally watched #WonderWoman1984. Maybe don’t think too much about what’s going on in the movie. My headcanon is that the only reason it takes place in 1984 is because it’s pre-crisis
